definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: The nose must be clearly in front of the vertical.
sentences.chinese: 馬鼻必須明顯的在垂直線的前方。

sentences.english: They are placed on both sides of an imaginary vertical line on the page which goes through the middle of the user’s screen.
sentences.chinese: 他們都被放置在用戶屏幕中間一條虛構垂直線的兩端。

sentences.english: Or you might say this situation, mP because now we have the center of mass, mP, vertical line.
sentences.chinese: 也許你會說，由於存在重心，垂直線。

sentences.english: Horizontal lines imply tranquility and rest, whereas vertical lines imply power and strength.
sentences.chinese: 水平線表示寧靜和安定，而垂直線表明權力和力量。

sentences.english: The vertical line meets the horizontal one here.
sentences.chinese: 垂直線與水平線在此相交。

sentences.english: Emit TWO vertical line and one horizontal line, plumb below point.
sentences.chinese: 可產生二條垂直線和一條水平線，帶下對點。

sentences.english: Behind him the rain trickling down the window made verticals on the glass.
sentences.chinese: 他身後的雨滴落在窗戶上，在玻璃上劃出一道垂直線。
